page.title: 15TOURISM-EYNSFORD
page.content: We are only 20 miles from London, very near the M20 and attract many visitors. Eynsford has interesting medieval houses, a 15th century Bridge over the River Darent, the ruins of a Norman castle and a church with its sided spire and a 13th century porch. Tourists come enjoy the village and many artistic people have decided to live in the area. A boy in our class lives in Willow Cottage where Graham Sutherland the artist lived. Peter Warlock the composer once lived in a cottage near our school. C. Ross Parker who wrote There'll Always be an England' lived here until 1974. At weekends and holidays we get lots of day trippers down by the river.
